intro: Hieracium trondense, commonly known as the Trondenes hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as tundra and rocky slopes. It has slender stems and small, yellowish to brownish composite flowers. Hieracium trondense is adapted to cold climates and has a low growth form to avoid damage from strong winds and freezing temperatures.
